file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-20-09-04 - AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT CARDAN OF THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT CARDAN OF THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the cardan of the auxiliary drag strut of the nose landing gear. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT CARDAN OF ALL 32-20-09-000-801-A THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT CARDAN OF ALL 32-20-09-400-801-A THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - INSTALLA- TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-20-09 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-20-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT CARDAN OF THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the auxiliary drag strut cardan of the nose landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH or LH Nose Landing Gear 1 Helps the other technician RH or LH Main Landing Gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) For aircraft PRE-MOD. S.B.145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200. (2) For aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-32-0036, install the safety pin to the NLG doors solenoid valve AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-09 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (4) Make sure that the safety pins of the landing gears are installed AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200. (5) Lift the aircraft on jacks AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) To remove the cardan (14), do as follows: (a) Release the cardan (14) from the upper auxiliary drag strut (8) as follows: 1 Remove the cotter pin (12), nut (11), washer (10), shaft (9), and bolt (7). (b) Release the cardan (14) from the nose fuselage structure (13) as follows: 1 Remove the cotter pin (1), nut (2), washers (3) and (5), shaft (4), and bolt (6). (c) Remove the cardan (14). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-09 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Auxiliary Drag Strut Cardan of the Nose Landing Gear - Removal/Installation Figure 401 AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT B A ZONE 711 DET. A 1. COTTER PIN 1 2. NUT 3. WASHER 4. SHAFT 5. WASHER 2 6. BOLT 14. CARDAN 2 7. BOLT 9. SHAFT 10. WASHER 13. NOSE FUSELAGE STRUCTURE 11. NUT 8. AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT 12. COTTER PIN DET. B 1 TORQUE: 6 TO 7.45 N.m (53 TO 66 lb.in) 2 APPLY SEALANT COR-BAN 27 L EM145AMM320495A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-09 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-20-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. AUXILIARY DRAG STRUT CARDAN OF THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the auxiliary drag strut cardan of the nose landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL EXTENSION AND RETRACTION SYSTEM - OPERA- AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500 TIONAL CHECK S.B.145-32-0036 - TASK 32-34-00-720-001-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque Wrench, 6 to 7.45 N.m (53 to 66 To apply torque available lb.in.) E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves resistant to Phosphate For protection of the hands 2 available Ester-Base Fluids Commercially Rubber Goggles resistant to Phosphate For protection of the eyes 2 available Ester-Base Fluids F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP09-075 Corrosion Inhibitive Compound COR-BAN 27L AR MS 24665-153 Cotter pin 2 G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-20-09 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH or LH Nose Landing Gear 1 Helps the other technician RH or LH Main Landing Gear I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: DO NOT GET COR-BAN 27L IN YOUR MOUTH OR EYES, OR ON YOUR SKIN. DO NOT BREATHE THE FUMES FROM COR-BAN 27L. PUT ON A PROTECTIVE SPLASH GOGGLE AND GLOVES WHEN YOU USE COR- BAN 27L. COR-BAN 27L IS A TOXIC MATERIAL. (1) To install the cardan (14), do as follows: (a) Install the cardan (14) on the auxiliary drag strut (8) as follows: 1 Apply COR-BAN 27L to the bolt (7). 2 Install the bolt (7), washer (10), shaft (9), nut (11), and cotter pin (12). (b) Install the cardan (14) on the nose fuselage structure (13) as follows: 1 Apply COR-BAN 27L to the bolt (6). 2 Install the bolt (6), washers (5) and (3), shaft (4), and nut (2). 3 Apply a torque of 6 to 7.5 N.m (53 to 66 lb.in) to the nut (2). 4 Install the cotter pin (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) For aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-32-0036, remove the safety pin from the NLG doors solenoid valve AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200. (2) Energize the aircraft. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and close it. (4) Remove the safety pins from the landing gears. (5) Do an operational check of the MLG ( AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500). (6) Do the functional check of the landing gear free-fall system (TASK 32-34-00-720-001- A). (7) Lower the aircraft and remove the jacks (AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-20-09 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
